pull.title: log: rate limiting followups
pull.body:
Followups to #32604.

The only behavior change is that prefixing with `[*]` is done to all logs (regardless of `should_ratelimit`) per https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2195710943. This does not need a release note as the release notes were already a bit vague as pointed out in the comment.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33011.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

Addressed in this PR:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188529752
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2163341392
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2163349298
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2182919153
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2185313756
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188155450
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188156156
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188158176
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188159134
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188161714
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188231409
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188256330
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188285962
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188544998
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188548959
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2194330070
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2195710943

Not addressed:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2115869345
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188158709
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188237233
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188643445
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188644325
  - The comment for `MakeUCharSpan` says that it works with unsigned char and `file_name()` uses bare char -- this was concerning. Also, `CSipHasher& Write(uint64_t data)` may only be used if a [multiple of 8 bytes have been written so far](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/11c6a864c9ee3a9bbd65720517fd22c155fd9060/src/crypto/siphash.h#L26-L28).
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188651877
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188652258
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2194621936
  - Removed `BOOST_CHECK_THROW` and `BOOST_CHECK_NO_THROW`, so no longer relevant.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#issuecomment-3054117201
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32604#discussion_r2188225785
  - Not convinced recursion is bad in this case.

The comment links under "Not addressed" _without_ rationale are all good to implement, but I did want to limit 1) the number of commits and 2) the amount of new logic a reviewer would have to go through.

<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

verification.payload:
tree 3117b8eadb7ed4fc3d78e5fedd2735efbb7d597b
parent b510844e1a0a558b6057d6b6feff673cc6142167
author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1752849585 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1753109637 -0400

log: clean up LogPrintStr_ and Reset, prefix all logs with "[*]" when there are suppressions

In LogPrintStr_:
- remove an unnecessary BCLog since we are in the BCLog namespace.
- remove an unnecessary \n when rate limiting is triggered since
  FormatLogStrInPlace will add it.
- move the ratelimit bool into an else if block.
- prefix all log lines with [*] when suppressions exist. Previously this
  was only done if should_ratelimit was true.

In Reset:
- remove an unnecessary \n since FormatLogStrInPlace will add it.
- Change Level::Info to Level::Warning.

- prefix all log lines with [*] when suppressions exist. Previously this

In Reset:
- remove an unnecessary \n since FormatLogStrInPlace will add it.
- Change Level::Info to Level::Warning.

verification.payload:
tree d41d4a180f25ad203d25c8aebbb4ed50025ee66d
parent 8b4103c161dd390a7a446eeb9bee2c7d0d44ad5b
author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1752849740 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1753109637 -0400

test: clean up logging_filesize_rate_limit, LogFromLocation*

- Introduce `enum class Location` in place of magic ints and use
  this in LogFromLocation and LogFromLocationAndExpect.
- Change LogFromLocation to use LogDebug and LogPrintLevel_ (with
  should_ratelimit=false) to test that these functions may bypass
  the rate limiting logic.
- Use brace initialization where applicable.
- Replace auto usage with explicit types.
- Remove unnecessary comments.
- Replace BOOST_CHECK_MESSAGE with BOOST_CHECK.
- Remove confusing BOOST_CHECK_NO_THROW and BOOST_CHECK_THROW.

events.message:
test: clean up logging_filesize_rate_limit, LogFromLocation*

- Introduce `enum class Location` in place of magic ints and use
  this in LogFromLocation and LogFromLocationAndExpect.
- Change LogFromLocation to use LogDebug and LogPrintLevel_ (with
  should_ratelimit=false) to test that these functions may bypass
  the rate limiting logic.
- Use brace initialization where applicable.
- Replace auto usage with explicit types.
- Remove unnecessary comments.
- Replace BOOST_CHECK_MESSAGE with BOOST_CHECK.
- Remove confusing BOOST_CHECK_NO_THROW and BOOST_CHECK_THROW.
